executable.title: Positive Pixel Count
executable.description: Counts different types of positive pixels based on values in the HSI color space
executable.acknowledgements: This work is part of the HistomicsTK project.

image.name: inputImageFile
image.label: Input Image
image.description: Input image in which to count and classify positive pixels

region.name: region
region.label: Analysis ROI
region.description: Region of interest where analysis is performed. This is either -1,-1,-1,-1 for the whole image, or a four-element vector in the format "left, top, width, height", or a list of four or more x,y vertices to specify a polygon.

float.name: hue_value
float.label: Hue Value
float.description: Center of the hue range in HSI space for the positive color, in the range [0, 1]

float.name: hue_width
float.label: Hue Width
float.description: Width of the hue range in HSI space

float.name: saturation_minimum
float.label: Minimum Saturation
float.description: Minimum saturation of positive pixels in HSI space, in the range [0, 1]

float.name: intensity_upper_limit
float.label: Upper Intensity Limit
float.description: Intensity threshold in HSI space above which a pixel is considered negative, in the range [0, 1]

float.name: intensity_weak_threshold
float.label: Intensity Threshold for Weak Pixels
float.description: Intensity threshold in HSI space that separates weak-positive pixels (above) from plain positive pixels (below)

float.name: intensity_strong_threshold
float.label: Intensity Threshold for Strong Pixels
float.description: Intensity threshold in HSI space that separates plain positive pixels (above) from strong positive pixels (below)

float.name: intensity_lower_limit
float.label: Lower Intensity Limit
float.description: Intensity threshold in HSI space below which a pixel is considered negative

image.name: outputLabelImage
image.label: Output Label Image
image.description: Color-coded image of the region, showing the various classes of pixel

string-enumeration.name: outputImageForm
string-enumeration.label: Image Format
string-enumeration.description: The output image can either be colored for easy visibility or coded as categorical values where 0 is negative, 1 weak, 2 plain, and 3 strong

file.name: outputAnnotationFile
file.label: Image Annotation
file.description: Annotation to relate the image to the source (*.anot)

float.name: NumberWeakPositive
float.label: Number of Weak Positive Pixels
float.description: Number of pixels classified as weak positive

float.name: NumberPositive
float.label: Number of Positive Pixels
float.description: Number of pixels classified as simply positive

float.name: NumberStrongPositive
float.label: Number of Strong Positive Pixels
float.description: Number of pixels classified as strong positive

float.name: IntensitySumWeakPositive
float.label: Sum of Intensities of Weak Positive Pixels
float.description: Number of pixels classified as weak positive

float.name: IntensitySumPositive
float.label: Sum of Intensities of Positive Pixels
float.description: Number of pixels classified as simply positive

float.name: IntensitySumStrongPositive
float.label: Sum of Intensities of Strong Positive Pixels
float.description: Number of pixels classified as strong positive

float.name: IntensityAverage
float.label: Average Intensity
float.description: Average intensity of across all positive pixels

float.name: RatioStrongToTotal
float.label: Ratio of Strong Pixels to Total Pixels
float.description: The fraction of positive pixels that are strong

float.name: IntensityAverageWeakAndPositive
float.label: Average Intensity of Weak and Plain Positive Pixels
float.description: Average intensity of positive pixels excluding strong positive pixels

string.name: frame
string.label: Frame Index
string.description: Frame index in a multi-frame image

string.name: style
string.label: Style Options
string.description: Image style options for compositing a multi-frame image

string.name: scheduler
string.label: Scheduler Address
string.description: Address of a dask scheduler in the format '127.0.0.1:8786'. Not passing this parameter sets up a dask cluster on the local machine. 'multiprocessing' uses Python multiprocessing. 'multithreading' uses Python multiprocessing in threaded mode.

integer.name: num_workers
integer.label: Number of workers
integer.description: Number of dask workers to start while setting up a local cluster internally. If a negative value is specified then the number of workers is set to number of cpu cores on the machine minus the number of workers specified.

integer.name: num_threads_per_worker
integer.label: Number of threads per worker
integer.description: Number of threads to use per worker while setting up a local cluster internally. Must be a positive integer >= 1.
